column4: i put some folder under picasa folder, using nautilus opened from terminal, but now the folders are inaccessible, please help
what folder exactly?
i copy some web template into web template folder under picasa
what is the path to the folder that is giving you issues?
now i see that there's "x" mark beside the inaccessible folders
it's: opt/picasa/wine/drive_c/Program FIles/Picasa2/web/templates
ok.  What does this command return: ls -ld '/opt/picasa/wine/drive_c/Program FIles/Picasa2/web/templates'
it said cannot access bla bla bla, no such file or directory
write "Files" instead of "FIles" maybe
ya i did write Files
the path you gave me originally had "FIles".  Does that work?
it was my mistype
btw, I've just been thinking, if I open nautilus as root (sudo nautilus from terminal), and try to see the folder permission properties, maybe it can help?
let me see first and I report again if I can do something or not
that would be one way yes, but I won't understand what you are doing then
just now I see that for some default folders there, the permissions properties for "group" and "others" folders are set as "access files" versus "none" in the inaccessible folders
I think it is the problem
sure, check ownership as well
it works
ownership is still root
so to solve the problem, change the folder access right in the properties of the folder, via nautilus (open as root)
thanks for your response & help, though
glad you figured it out
thanks, have a nice day :-)
